modules.title: Module 1 (Introduction to NCDs)
modules.description: Understanding Non-Communicable Diseases and their impact on adolescent health. This module covers the basics of NCDs, the Big-7 risk factors, and how to identify and prevent these diseases.

1.question: Which of the following is a Non-communicable Disease (NCD)?
Which of the following is one of the BIG 7 risk factors that causes NCDs?
What does the "S" in BE FAST for stroke stand for?

Alcohol use increases the risk of:
Physical inactivity increases the risk of:
Excessive sedentary screen time increases risk of:

5.question: Which of the following best defines “screen time”?

B. Any time spent interacting with devices that have screens, such as phones, tablets, or TVs

7.question: 1.	What is stress?
options: A. A state of complete relaxation
B. The body's natural response to challenges, often called the "fight, flight, or freeze" response
C. Only negative emotions like anger or sadness
D. A permanent condition that cannot be managed

7.question: 2.	Which of the following is a common physical signal of stress?
options: A. Feeling energized all the time
B. Sweaty palms or a racing heart

7.question: 3.	What is a common source of stress for teenagers?
options: A. Academic pressure from exams and heavy workloads
B. Having too much free time
C. Lack of responsibilities at home
D. Always feeling included in social groups

7.question: 4.	How can chronic stress affect your physical health?
options: A. It improves your immune system
B. It can lead to sleep problems and a weakened immune system
C. It does not affect your body
D. It only affects your mental health

7.question: 5.	Which of the following is an example of a negative thought pattern associated with stress?
options: A. Thinking you can improve with practice
B. Catastrophizing, or imagining the worst possible outcome
C. Believing you did your best despite challenges
D. Focusing on positive aspects of a situation

7.question: 6.	What is the purpose of the "Catch It, Check It, Change It" technique?
options: A. To ignore negative thoughts completely
B. To identify, challenge, and reframe unhelpful thoughts
C. To avoid stressful situations entirely
D. To focus only on positive emotions

7.question: 7.	Which stress management technique involves focusing on the present moment without judgment?
8.	How can physical activity help manage stress?
options: A. It increases stress hormones in the body
B. It releases endorphins, which are natural mood boosters
C. It makes you feel more tired and stressed
D. It does not affect stress levels

7.question: 9.	Why is social support important for managing stress?
options: A. It eliminates all sources of stress
B. It provides a buffer against stress through healthy relationships
C. It encourages you to avoid responsibilities
D. It makes stress worse by adding pressure

7.question: 10.	What does resilience mean in the context of stress management?
options: A. Never experiencing stress or challenges
B. The ability to bounce back and grow stronger from difficult situations
D. Always feeling happy and relaxed
